title: Top NFL Draft prospect Fernando Mendoza enthralled by possibility of Tom Brady mentorship: ‘It would mean so much’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Top NFL Draft prospect Fernando Mendoza expresses enthusiasm about potential mentorship from Tom Brady with the Raiders.
Mendoza, a 22-year-old Indiana Hoosiers QB, achieved college acclaim with a Heisman Trophy and National Championship.
Tom Brady, part-owner of Las Vegas Raiders, is Mendoza's admired figure; he sees mentoring opportunity as valuable.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Kiss of the Spider Woman' starring Jennifer Lopez is streaming on Hulu.
'Paul McCartney: Man on the Run' documentary is available on Prime Video.
'Bridgerton' Season 4 focusing on Benedict Bridgerton is streaming on Netflix.

title: Red Sox’ Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela say they’re fine after outfield collision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela collided during a Red Sox spring training game against the Braves.
Both players remained on the ground briefly but continued playing, later recording hits against Chris Sale.
Anthony and Rafaela attributed the collision to a communication error while tracking the fly ball.

title: Alex Cora to donate $20K to Jimmy Fund when 2026 Red Sox hit this milestone
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora pledges $20,000 to the Jimmy Fund once a player hits 20 home runs in 2026.
Cora's pledge aligns with his history of supporting the Boston-based charity linked to the Dana-Farber Cancer Institute.
Cora previously donated $113.13 per Red Sox win in 2021, totaling $10,407.96, along with other contributions.

title: N.H. House advances bill targeting ‘indoctrination’ in public schools
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: The New Hampshire House passed the CHARLIE Act, targeting critical race theory and LGBTQ+ teachings in public schools.
The bill prohibits teachings on division, critical consciousness, and requires a neutral or patriotic disposition in education.
Teachers violating the act could face disciplinary actions, including revocation of credentials, and schools could face lawsuits.

title: The story behind these colorful icicles in the Berkshires
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Colorful icicles on Route 2 in North Adams are made using food coloring, a local tradition for decades.
The icicles, found along the Hairpin Turn, have become a popular social media subject during winters.
The Hairpin Turn on Route 2 offers scenic views and is near attractions like The Golden Eagle Restaurant and MASS MoCA.

title: Mass. reports first two measles cases of 2026, including one in Greater Boston
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts confirms first measles cases of 2026 in a Greater Boston adult and a school-aged child.
The adult with measles visited multiple locations in Greater Boston, potentially exposing others, state officials report.
The U.S. reports 1,136 measles cases in 2026; Massachusetts maintains low risk due to high vaccination rates.

title: Local obituary: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, lifelong South Boston resident and mother of 2
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, a lifelong South Boston resident and mother, passed away on February 21, 2026.
Morgan was known for her community involvement including her role in a Dunkin' Donuts commercial with Rob Gronkowski.
Visiting hours are March 3, 2026, with a funeral Mass on March 4 at St. Mary of the Assumption Church, Dedham.

title: She’s running Boston for The ALS Association in memory of her dad
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Lauren Hamilton, 26, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon in memory of her father who died from ALS.
Hamilton aims to raise awareness for ALS, a disease that claimed her father when she was 25 years old.
Her marathon run honors her father's legacy and supports families impacted by ALS through The ALS Association.

title: DiZoglio files emergency motion after AG Campbell moves to strike down audit lawsuit
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio filed an emergency motion with the Supreme Judicial Court over her legislative audit lawsuit.
Attorney General Andrea Campbell moved to strike DiZoglio's lawsuit, questioning the auditor's authority and citing legal procedures.
House Speaker Ron Mariano and Senate President Karen Spilka oppose the audit, citing separation of powers and privacy concerns.
